ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 4-7 hours/week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This is a great course for beginners or more advanced students who want to brush up on their genetics. This course moves at precisely the correct pace.
Excellent course. very detailed and insightful.

I enjoyed the labs to bring the practical aspect of the course. I also enjoyed all of the examples used in the PowerPoints. However, I think it would have helped a lot to include more molecular epidemiological studies, especially focusing on the methods and design of the studies.

I had previously taken the other molecular epi course offered several years ago, but decided to take this one as well because the syllabus looked a lot different. I think I got a lot out of it, the focus was on emerging research and techniques in the field and I think this will be very helpful in my future research.
I really enjoyed this course. It was a great introduction to molecular epi, and will be extremely beneficial later on to have had exposure to the various techniques and concepts in genetics.

I enjoyed this course! The range of topics discussed was very interesting and well balanced and I felt that the homework assignments, labs, and final presentations did a good job of tieing the course topics together. I learned alot and found this to be one of the more interesting and useful courses that I've taken at YSPH so far.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Yong Zhu  Dr. Zhu does a great job of focusing on learning key material, rather than overly pedantic memorization.He is also very personable and responsive.
Instructor: Yong Zhu  Dr.Zhu is very responsible, helpful and insightful.

Instructor: Yong Zhu  Dr. Zhu did a great job in teaching this course, and i enjoyed his thorough powerpoints. However, I never received a returned assignment from this class. That would have greatly helped.

Instructor: Yong Zhu  Dr. Zhu did a great job with this class. I think that its clear that hes really excited about the material and he presented it in a way that was clear for people who may not be very familiar with molecular epi techniques. I liked the laboratory components, because I think it was useful to get some hands on experience. I also thought some of the homeworks were really helpful in illustrating what we discusses in class, for example designing primers.
Instructor: Yong Zhu  Dr. Zhu is a wonderful professor; I really enjoyed taking his course!

Instructor: Yong Zhu  I thought that Dr. Zhu was a great instructor. He was very enthusiastic and approachable and did a good job of explaining the material in lecture and explaining the applicability of the material to current research methods etc.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Alan Fu  Alan was a helpful TA. He definitely knows his stuff. Thanks, Alan!
Instructor: Alan Fu  Alan is really great in helping us prepare for the Lab and very patient.
Instructor: Alan Fu  Alan did a great job preparing materials and explaining the concepts.
Instructor: Alan Fu  Alan was great, very helpful in lab and very quick to respond to questions when I emailed him.
Instructor: Alan Fu  Alan was wonderful! He is great at explaining difficult concepts, and was great leading our labs.
Instructor: Alan Fu  Alan was a great TF. He was very good at answering questions and helpful in lab.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend this course for any student interested in genetics or who plans on doing genetic research. This course ensures that you know the fundamentals to understand a genetics article, which is extremely useful.
I would highly recommend this course.

I think this course is a really good intro to molecular epi. I would actually recommend it to all the CDE MPH and doctoral students who have any interest in this type of research. It is not too heavy on the workload but you will come away with a good understanding of the subject.
Yes, I would recommend!
